info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 9:44PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Perry, Jackson and eastern Perry Counties through 1030 PM CDT... At 944 PM CDT, amateur radio operators reported strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Chester to 6 miles southeast of Perryville. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Amateur radio. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Willisville and Altenburg around 1000 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Ava, Grand Tower, Murphysboro, Cedar Lake Area, Carbondale, Du Quoin, De Soto, Elkville and Hurst. This includes Interstate 55 between Mile Markers 121 and 126. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
